snippet: A report found that counties like Westchester, Nassau and Suffolk faced tough competition from New York City for young people, perhaps because of less diversity and a dearth of modest rentals.
abstract: Report on counties of Westchester, Nassau and Suffolk, based on United States census data, finds that young people seem to be staying put in New York City, perhaps because suburbs offer less diversity and dearth of modest rentals; some suburban towns are trying to make themselves more alluring to young residents by building apartment complexes, concert venues, bicycle lanes and more exotic restaurants.
lead_paragraph: A report found that counties like Westchester, Nassau and Suffolk faced tough competition from New York City for young people, perhaps because of less diversity and a dearth of modest rentals.

headline.main: Suburbs Try to Prevent an Exodus as Young Adults Move to Cities and Stay
headline.print_headline: Suburbs Try to Prevent an Exodus as Young Adults Move to Cities and Stay
